title: Right triangle
summary: A right triangle (American English) or right-angled triangle (British), or more formally an orthogonal triangle (Ancient Greek: ὀρθόςγωνία, lit. 'upright angle'),[1] is a triangle in which one angle is a right angle (that is, a 90-degree angle).  The relation between the sides and other angles of the right triangle is the basis for trigonometry.
